<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="comment">|&#42; This header declares the C interface to libLLVMBitReader.a, which          &#42;|</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="comment">|&#42; implements input of the LLVM bitcode format.                               &#42;|</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="comment">|&#42;                                                                            &#42;|</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="comment">|&#42; Many exotic languages can interoperate with C code but have a harder time  &#42;|</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="comment">|&#42; with C++ due to name mangling. So in addition to C, this interface enables &#42;|</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="comment">|&#42; tools written in such languages.                                           &#42;|</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="comment">|&#42;                                                                            &#42;|</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="comment">\\&#42;===----------------------------------------------------------------------===&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
